body.p:
Louisville March 10. 1862
Jas Speed Esqr
Dear Sir --

Theodore G. Shaw, of the first ward of this city, desires ^for himself^ the appointment office of a Notary Public, he tells me there is not one in that ward, and that public convenience requires such an appointment -- Mr Shaw is an intelligent worthy gentleman, few more so, and if such an appointment is made by his excellency the Govr he could not find a^one^ more worthy of the office, than Mr Shaw, your immediate attention to this will oblige
your friend very &c Edwd D Hobbs
